decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing spirits with strong synergy and tribal support to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. It aims to maintain board control with disruptive spells like Spell Queller and removal like Path to Exile, while also leveraging cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to efficiently cast creatures and rebuild the board. The inclusion of cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom further enhances the spirits' abilities and helps maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of tempo plays and disruptive elements, the deck aims to close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outlast opponents and maintain board control. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently answering threats and gradually outvaluing them with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Card advantage is gained through spells like Ancestral Vision and Search for Azcanta, while Terminus acts as a board wipe. The deck aims to control the game until it can close out with a win condition like Celestial Colonnade.

This deck focuses on using Spirit creatures with low mana costs to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to quickly bring out multiple creatures, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and apply pressure early on. Additionally, cards like Spell Queller and Drogskol Captain provide disruption and protection for your creatures, allowing you to maintain your board presence and keep up the pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes. It aims to stall the game while generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta. The win condition is often through a combination of Celestial Colonnade beatdowns and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix. The deck also has access to powerful instant-speed spells like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage to outmaneuver the opponent. Mana base includes fetch lands and utility lands for flexibility and consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively gain life and control the board with cards like Martyr of Sands, Serra Ascendant, and Path to Exile, while using graveyard recursion and land destruction to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stabilize quickly with efficient creatures and removal spells, while eventually overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Sun Titan and Archangel Avacyn. The combination of lifegain, control, and recursion allows for a resilient and versatile strategy that can adapt to different matchups in a Modern 1 vs 1 environment.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate a large amount of mana, dig through the deck for combo pieces, and then cast a powerful card like Grapeshot multiple times in a single turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards that reduce the cost of spells like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to generate mana, and card draw spells to help find the combo pieces needed to win the game. The deck aims to win by assembling the combo and executing it as quickly as possible.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes while drawing cards and utilizing planeswalkers like Jace and Teferi to gain advantage and control the game. By controlling the board and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game through incremental advantage and strong late-game threats like Celestial Colonnade. Ultimately, the key strategy is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and superior decision-making.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Teferi, along with counterspells and removal spells to handle threats from the opponent. The deck also utilizes card draw with Ancestral Vision to ensure a steady stream of resources. The win condition is through creature lands like Celestial Colonnade and controlling the board with cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifact creatures and use Ensoul Artifact and Cranial Plating to make them powerful threats. The deck aims to attack aggressively with evasive creatures like Vault Skirge and Inkmoth Nexus, while also having protective measures like Stubborn Denial and Steel Overseer to protect its creatures. The deck also has the ability to generate card advantage and create a wide board presence with Sai, Master Thopterist. Overall, this deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and versatile aggro strategy centered around artifact creatures.

The deck focuses on leveraging Spirit creatures with abilities that disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing an aggressive clock. The key strategy involves using cards like Spell Queller and Drogskol Captain to protect your board and pressure the opponent. Collected Company allows for explosive turns by putting multiple threats into play at once. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play at instant speed. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable powerful plays early in the game.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing graveyard interaction and sacrificing creatures to generate value and create a powerful board presence. By cycling through the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, the deck aims to quickly fill the battlefield with creatures like Vengevine, Bloodghast, and Gravecrawler. With powerful combo potential from cards like Bridge from Below and Greater Gargadon, along with the ability to quickly close out games with Goblin Bushwhacker and Walking Ballista, this deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with speed and efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Bridge from Below, Gravecrawler, and Bloodghast while using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to help set up combos. Then, utilizing cards like Greater Gargadon and Vengevine to bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent. Walking Ballista and Goblin Bushwhacker provide additional ways to close out the game quickly, making this deck a fast and aggressive combo-based strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards and creatures to trigger powerful abilities and combos. It utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to discard and mill cards, while also relying on cards like Vengevine and Bridge from Below to bring creatures back from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler, while also utilizing cards like Greater Gargadon to control the board and finish off the opponent with cards like Walking Ballista and Goblin Bushwhacker.

This deck focuses on quickly building up +1/+1 counters on creatures with Hardened Scales, allowing for explosive growth and aggressive plays. With the combination of Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with massive creatures. Animation Module and Hangarback Walker provide extra value and resiliency, while Path to Exile offers removal for problematic creatures. Mox Opal helps to ramp up mana early on, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the deck. The deck aims to win through fast and efficient beatdowns.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and powerful creatures along with disruption spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push while utilizing hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and disruption spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with counter spells like Cryptic Command, Logic Knot, and Negate. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Path to Exile and board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Terminus to deal with threats. Card draw and filtering is provided by Serum Visions, Opt, and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to out-value the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition, often through Celestial Colonnade beats.
